data.content:
Were going on a 1.8-billion-mile journey to an ocean world  Jupiter moon, Europa!
 
@EuropaClipper is set to launch on Monday, Oct. 14, on a @SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket at 12:06pm ET (1606 UTC) from @NASAKennedy. Use #AskNASA to send us your questions. https://t.co/o3xgleA6Z3

data.content:
We have signed a contract with @D_Orbit  to develop our RISE mission at @IAC2024.

Set for launch in early 2028, with a lifetime of 8 years, RISE will push the boundaries of in-orbit servicing.

Find out more  https://t.co/QCQZWzfXPA

#IAC2024

How many heads of space agencies can we get in one room?

 Join us live at 14:45 BST/15:45 CEST to find out!

Expect to hear from  Josef Aschbacher, ESA Director General; Bill Nelson, NASA Administrator; Sreedhara Somanath, ISRO Chairman; Hiroshi Yamakawa, JAXA President; Lisa https://t.co/Dyg1iUTVpj

France and Germany join U.S.-led space defense coalition

data.content:
Farewell, Earth! 

Last week, after we successfully launched our Hera mission, its instruments were switched on for the first time and the asteroid deck was pointed back towards our planet.

This allowed Hera to capture the first images of Earth and the Moon from a distance https://t.co/usrZtxapRU

old_updates.data: The Expanding Battlefield: Army Pushes into Space Warfare

data.content: Live now: Watch the opening ceremony of the 75th edition of the International Astronautical Congress  https://t.co/JX0lpRhdwG

We are attending the 75th edition of the International Astronautical Congress in Milan from 14-18 October.
 
Here we will present Europes future space ambitions and how to get there. Stay tuned for announcements throughout the days.
 
 Join us live for the opening ceremony https://t.co/LOrkqbFyYg

Watch as our largest planetary spacecraft takes flight!

@EuropaClipper is targeted to launch at 12:06pm ET (1606 UTC) on a Falcon Heavy rocket from @NASAKennedy, beginning its journey to Jupiters ocean moon, Europa. https://t.co/ajxnh7LMhQ

The CSA is delighted to be joining our international space partners and Canadian companies at @IAC2024 this week to talk Responsible Space for Sustainability. Looking forward to fruitful discussions! https://t.co/z4lfqrbkKD

Our favorite color is October. 

Here's a satellite image of the Clearwater River Valley, located in Saskatchewan and Alberta, showing its beautiful fall colors. This gorgeous place was granted Canadian Heritage River status.
 
 Sentinel-2 L2A. https://t.co/PwnMQ9BVK5

New Zealand, Mexico and 22 other entities and organisations have signed the Zero Debris Charter at #IAC2024 solidifying their commitment to the long-term sustainability of human activities in Earth orbit.

This brings the total number of signatures to over 100.
 
The Zero Debris https://t.co/QXrkR3SFzh

The world's largest space conference @IAC2024 in Milan, Italy is about to start! Please visit us at #JAXA booth (ES-0E5).

#IAC2024 @iafastro https://t.co/Y2bjZnYzbc

Live: Could Jupiter's ocean moon Europa have conditions favorable for supporting life? Hear directly from scientists working to answer that question with our @EuropaClipper mission, set to launch Oct. 14. https://t.co/W6l4Efj1df https://t.co/G2CH61lBvX
Check out our #WeekInImages 7-11 October 2024  https://t.co/jtr9jWyysK https://t.co/RepRvMgTxj

data.content:
Is seeing aurora on your bucket list?

Now is the perfect time to view it! 

The Sun is currently undergoing a large geomagnetic storm. This means that it is sending out big bursts of charged particles which is causing our night skies to glow with auroras.

 Managed to see it

data.content:
Canada's NIRISS instrument on @NASAWebb helped astronomers from @Umontrealexplore GJ 9827 d, an exoplanet that could be a steam world!

More details: https://t.co/oCmT2z3Tr5

: NASA, ESA, Leah Hustak (STScI), Ralf Crawford (STScI) https://t.co/foGtr1zNKH

In praise of mystery 

After a successful launch aboard a @SpaceX Falcon Heavy rocket from @NASAKennedy, @EuropaClipper is on its way from our ocean world to another to see if Jupiter's moon Europa has conditions suitable for life: https://t.co/nfI8RjiAuQ https://t.co/rLJdUg7VHk
